input_text:
Job Title: Senior Cloud Engineer

Location: Irvine, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Digital connectivity for everyone. Shape it today.

About The Role

The Workplace Technology team provides the technology and tools to enable Boldyn colleagues globally to work seamlessly through the delivery of an exceptional Digital Employee Experience. This role is the senior engineer and SME for all enterprise Cloud, Workplace, and Identity Technology environments across Boldyn Networks, covering design, configuration, and operation. The Global Digital and Technology (GDT) team is spread across multiple locations in the US and UK, and as a global role, this person will deal with Market and Group colleagues.

The successful candidate will ensure we make the best use of our cloud services, support existing functionality, and bring innovation and great ideas to push the boundaries of the platform.

The role helps drive the adoption and development of our Microsoft platforms, and other cloud environments, ensuring interaction with our other key platforms within Boldyn Networks. The Senior Cloud Engineer will work to deliver projects, continuous improvement, manage and support Boldyn Networks Cloud and Workplace Platforms, and act as a point of escalation within the team.

The scope of the role includes responsibility for the Microsoft Azure and M365 Tenants, Boldyn Networks’ Microsoft Enterprise Agreement, Azure cost control, global identity and password management, and Single Sign On. The role will also review other SaaS products to identify opportunities to maximise our investment in Azure.

What You’ll Be Doing

You will take ownership of newly delivered environments to maintain great service through this transition period and beyond by embedding process and efficient onboarding and lead, design, deploy, and maintain the implementation of Cloud solutions using Microsoft Azure, M365 and underlying technologies.

You will act as the “go to” person and escalation point to solve more complex problems, incidents and requests, and drive a high performing team and provide technical expertise and challenge technical thinking for Boldyn Networks’ Cloud and Workplace platforms in response to incidents, problems, changes, and project work and ultimately be accountable for the technical delivery of services owned by the Workplace Technology team.

You’ll need to be collaborative as you work with people from across the organisation such as the Enterprise Architecture team to develop the roadmap for Cloud and Workplace Technology solutions, Group Information Security team to implement and maintain security policies and services associated with cloud or the Global IT Team across the US and Europe to solve problems and develop solutions.

Other activities include:

Working with the Group Architects in ensuring conformance to establishedarchitectures, standards, patterns and good practiceProvide technical expertise and challenge technical thinking for Boldyn Networks’ Cloudand Workplace platforms in response to incidents, problems, changes, and project workAccountable for the technical delivery of services owned by the Workplace Technology teamBe the “go to” person and escalation point to solve more complex problems, incidents and requestsWork to optimise the reliability, efficiency and value provided by cloud services (e.g., opportunities for automation)Ensure adherence to incident, request, problem and change management processes to agreed SLAsMaintain expert technical knowledge across the areas of cloud and workplace technologyManage the planning, acceptance and delivery of product upgradesOwn and manage the Azure and M365 tenancy and other cloud service including licensingProvide administration and deployment capabilities for cloud platforms such as Azure, addressing the provision and administration of virtual machines, Azure networking, virtual appliances and ensuring access requirements are met within the boundaries of information securityAdministration of the identity platform and integrations – groups and access, synchronisation, role admin and management of IdentityNowSingle sign-on application management including the delivery of new SSO requirementsMaintain CI/CD (continuous integration / continuous deployment) pipelines using GitHub toolsWork with the Global IT Team across the US and Europe to solve problems and develop solutionsWrite standard operating procedures, own documentation to cover implementation of solutions, including security, technical specifications, deployment and supportTraining our operations engineers to use and maintain the automation toolsUnderstand how the business is changing and update the existing documents, processes, methods, procedures, and tools to work with these changesProvide direction and support to GDT supportWorking with the Enterprise Architecture team to develop the roadmap for Cloud and Workplace Technology solutionsWork with Group Information Security team to implement and maintain security policies and services associated with cloud


What You’ll Bring

This role will suit a senior cloud engineer and self-starter looking to grow and broaden their skills, be a mentor within the team, and move their career towards a leadership or architecture position in the future. If you have the following experience, we would love to hear from you:

Proven Azure platform support , development, implementation and management experience including licencingMicrosoft Azure administration skills via IaCDeep technical cloud engineering experienceAzure AD security expertiseIdentity and Access Management experienceExperienced in Azure compute, networking, storage, and security, including Azure Firewall and NSGExperience with build tools, CI/CD, DevOps and agile principlesPossess an understanding of system testing including platform, integration, load and scale testingSingle Sign-On and Identity and Access management experience (ideally IdentityNow knowledge)Microsoft Azure certification requiredM365 certification advantageous


About Us

At Boldyn Networks, we’re reimagining the future of interconnectivity. Our network solutions are solving some of tomorrow’s greatest challenges. We are one team across the globe. Always listening. Learning. We value different perspectives and challenge each other to be our best. Here, you can change lives today and create a better tomorrow.

Why work with us?

We’re large enough to deliver and maintain large-scale operations, giving you the opportunity to work on exciting projects and expand your skills. You’ll be surrounded talented colleagues who thrive on solving problems, just like you. Together, you’ll make your mark on projects that matter and find new strengths along the way.

We also offer:

Salary: Up to - $180,000Annual OTE Bonus: 10%17,000 LinkedIn Learning coursesFlexible working opportunitiesParental leave with up to 20 weeks paid at full salaryVacation starting at 15 days increasing with length of service10 days paid sick leave4 days off each year to volunteer


Ready to apply?

Are you ready to create an impact that will last for generations? Join us at Boldyn Networks today. Hit apply and follow the instructions to get started.

Diversity recognises the ways we differ. Our backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. What makes us unique. And it’s important to us, to our future. To build a workforce that’s representative of the societies we serve. So that we can listen, learn and understand how to solve our customers’ problems in the smartest ways possible. We are looking for passionate people from a range of backgrounds and welcome applications from any race, age, gender, background, or religion.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
